list.name: Default
list.comment: worked on BFS function, has not tested its functionality yet

task.summary:
updated the functionality of the isLegalMove function: - Previously it did not consider any rules with 2 step moves/jumps - If a two step move is to be made, it now checks to see if there is a piece in the one step position before it returns true. If there is no piece inbetween it returns false. - this fixed this issue of more available moves being returned than expected.
implemented the availableMoves function, seems to work correctly, but need more test cases to verify this

added the project A file, and implemented the moves function - moves works -- need more test cases to test this out
started the implementation of updateBoardState - moves the pieces from old to new location on the board - need to implement the checker for eliminated pieces - need to update piece position and update the available moves

worked on updateBoard method and also the elimination methods --TODO : need to complete the twopiece elimination method -- possibly need to find a way to test the elimination more eloquently rather than checking all possible combinations via brute force

worked on updateBoard method and also the elimination methods --TODO : need to complete the twopiece elimination method -- possibly need to find a way to test the elimination more eloquently rather than checking all possible combinations via brute force

worked on updateBoard method and also the elimination methods --TODO : need to complete the twopiece elimination method -- possibly need to find a way to test the elimination more eloquently rather than checking all possible combinations via brute force

updated the elimination helper functions to use the lists containing the piece positions instead of the board configuration itself -- TODO: need to check if it works with some test cases and test values now

updated the elimination helper functions to use the lists containing the piece positions instead of the board configuration itself -- TODO: need to check if it works with some test cases and test values now
updated the updateBoard function to deal with eliminations TODO -- still need to do tests on each of the functions to see if it is working correctly

completed all TODO game mechanics work -- all methods seem to be functioning added massacre node and node classes for searching
TODO -- need to test further cases

got rid of redundant lists in the __init__ method of Board()
still need to test further cases and edge cases

commented test.py file --need to develop a script to test all possible configurations of the initial board. Randomise the locations of the pieces in the board and test both the moves function and the massacre function with it

added more comments changed the structure of hte availableMoves tuple to be piecePos,moveType this makes it easier to apply movetypes when exploring different combinations
### idea when exploring a new node during a search, create the new node first via a deepcopy, then apply the moveType to that node and called updateBoardState to apply the moveType and get this nodes configuration

started work on BFS function -- need to test if it works used deepcopy() to copy board classes and node classes such that you can edit child nodes without affecting the parent node TODO -- need to implement DFS DLS and ITDS in the Massacre class if we have time, implement A* and think of a heuristic to use to limit the number of nodes to search
worked on BFS function, has not tested its functionality yet
